newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Security tight around Yeltsin heart op hospital.
newsitem.headline: Security tight around Yeltsin heart op hospital.

text.p: A tight security cordon was thrown around Moscow's Cardiology Research Centre on Monday, where Russian President Boris Yeltsin will undergo a heart bypass operation.

On a grey, foggy morning, militia officers patrolled the roads and entrances around the hospital, a series of nondescript buildings of concrete and glass amid silver birch trees to the west of the Russian capital.

A guard in combat fatigues led a sniffer dog on a leash over a Volga sedan car while another officer checked the underside of the vehicle with a mirror before letting its driver through iron gates into the compound.
More security guards wearing red armbands walked around the grounds inside. An official car, black with a blue light on top, raced past.

"It's not too cold," said one officer, used to standing out in the city's sub-zero winter temperatures, a fur hat wedged on his head, a khaki anorak buttoned up tight. He pleaded with a television crew not to come too close.
Comments on the weather were all the tight-lipped security guards would volunteer.
A tired-looking doctor clutching a briefcase stopped before one of the gates and said he could not see what all the fuss was about.
"It's just a bypass operation, it's routine for us," said the doctor who said he worked at the hospital but who declined to give his name.
Sofia Tsiplova, 59, and wearing a smart velvet hat, waited for a bus home outside the hospital after collecting medicines for her own heart condition.
"I think he (Yeltsin) will be fine," said Tsiplova. "He's not the first -- they also operated on (Prime Minister Viktor) Chernomyrdin and he runs about like anything now."
Tsiplova said she had noticed no extraordinary activity inside the hospital. "They checked my documents carefully but it was quiet inside," she said.

Only Valentina Gorshkova, another 59-year-old pensioner walking past the hospital with a bright purple coat that stood out in the damp grey weather, showed any concern: "Of course we worry about his (Yeltsin's) operation...we're all human."
